avalancheActivity.comment:
The large quantity of fresh snow of the last few days as well as the wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack in some places. The snowpack remains unstable above approximately 2300 m. Artificially triggered avalanches confirm this situation.
Some large and, in isolated cases, very large natural avalanches are possible. This applies in case of releases originating from steep, high-altitude starting zones that still retain some snow.
Several medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large dry and wet avalanches have been released on Monday.
As a consequence of warming during the day dry and moist avalanches are possible, especially on sunny slopes, as well as in steep rocky terrain.
During the day: Moderate northwesterly wind. The fresh wind slabs will form in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. In addition the wind slabs of Sunday are capable of being triggered in some locations.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Avalanches are possible in starting zones where no previous releases have taken place. Snow sport activities outside marked and open pistes call for great caution and restraint.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area over a wide area 70 to 160 cm of snow has fallen since Friday above approximately 1800 m.
The southeasterly wind has transported some snow. Large wind slabs formed.
A lot of snow is lying at intermediate and high altitudes. New snow is lying on soft layers.
Towards its base, the snowpack is unfavourably layered.

tendency.comment: The avalanche danger will decrease gradually. A little new snow.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh snow of the last few days as well as the wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack in some places. Artificially triggered avalanches confirm this situation. Single winter sport participants can release avalanches, including large ones.
During the day: Moderate northwesterly wind. The fresh wind slabs will form in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. In addition the wind slabs of Sunday are capable of being triggered in some locations.
Medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large natural avalanches are possible, especially on sunny slopes, as well as in steep rocky terrain. As a consequence of warming during the day dry and moist avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs: Backcountry touring calls for defensive route selection.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area over a wide area 30 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen above approximately 1500 m.
The southeasterly wind has transported some snow.
Towards its base, the snowpack is unfavourably layered.

tendency.comment: The avalanche danger will persist. Some new snow.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh snow of the last few days as well as the wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack in some places. Artificially triggered avalanches confirm this situation. Single winter sport participants can release avalanches, including large ones.
During the day: Moderate northwesterly wind. The fresh wind slabs will form in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. In addition the wind slabs of Sunday are capable of being triggered in some locations.
Medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large natural avalanches are possible, especially on sunny slopes, as well as in steep rocky terrain.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs: Backcountry touring calls for defensive route selection.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area over a wide area 30 to 70 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen above approximately 1800 m.
The southeasterly wind has transported some snow. Sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed.
A lot of snow is lying at intermediate and high altitudes.
Towards its base, the snowpack is unfavourably layered.
